Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Dating: 2ND INTERMEDIATE PERIOD (not after); MIDDLE KINGDOM (not before)
Name: Seal impression
Description: The most used category of motifs, that of the spirals, is often called Hyksos for its common use in the Second Intermediate Period, but is found from the end of the 12th Dynasty onwards. The motifs can attain a remarkable complexity, as in this case, which is applied on papyrus.
